text: Passing a multi-line string as an argument to a script in Windows
I have a simple python script like so:

code:
import sys

lines = sys.argv[1]

for line in lines.splitlines():
    print line

text: I want to call it from the command line (or a .bat file) but the first argument may (and probably will) be a string with multiple lines in it.

code:
import sys

lines = """This is a string
It has multiple lines
there are three total"""

for line in lines.splitlines():
    print line

text: But I need to be able to process an argument line-by-line.
EDIT: This is probably more of a Windows command-line problem than a Python problem.
EDIT 2: Thanks for all of the good suggestions.
It doesn't look like it's possible.
I can't use another shell because I'm actually trying to invoke the script from another program which seems to use the Windows command-line behind the scenes.
